obfuscation: Later, Whoa there Jimmie; oh Grandpa I do love my pony, it 's the best of my whole presents; well it be time you put it inside his stall; myself 'm on na to 'il call my pony after Mr.----, 'Cause he looks just like him.
original: Whoa, there, Jimmie! Oh, Grandpa, I do love my pony. It's the best of all my presents. Well, it's time you put him in his stall. I'm going to call my pony after Mr. ----. 'Cause he looks just like him.

obfuscation: Without a doubt, And what hell are you on na to call your pony Snookums; going to call him Elizabeth following you Grandma; that 's my baby, yet grand we had better get our hats and coats; it 's nearly time for 's car to be following us; come Grandpa; yet it 's nearly eight o'clock.
original: And what are you going to call your pony, Snookums? Going to call him Elizabeth, after you, Grandma. That's my baby! Grandma, we'd better get our hats and coats. It's nearly time for the car to be after us. Come, Grandpa. It's nearly eight o'clock.

obfuscation: But myself do n't like to leaving children; also we do n't like to have you leave us neither, and my that has been the grandeur Christmas day myself 've ever seen; as come Grandma; and come child, myself 'm i 'm really glad you have had aforesaid merry Christmas.
original: But I don't like to leave the children. And we don't like to have you leave us, either. My, this has been the grandest Christmas day I've ever seen. Come, Grandma. Come, children. I'm glad you've had such a happy Christmas.

obfuscation: You got everything you wanted did not you, and yes all; my I wish Christmas would come every day, yet tell us story about former Saint Nick Grandpa; do you wan na to learn that former chestnut repeatedly, and oh yeah yes, oh this was just lovely.
original: You got everything you wanted, didn't you? Yes, everything. My, I wish Christmas would come every day. Tell us the story about old Saint Nick, Grandpa. Do you want to hear that old chestnut again? Oh, yes, yes! Oh, that was just lovely.

obfuscation: myself just wish myself could see him; and just once, and also then do I. myself 'm going to catch him a few Christmas Eve, me too; as here Grandpa put on your coat and hat or we will be late for the supper, and i would rather stay here also speak to children.
original: I just wish I could see him. Just once! And so do I. I'm going to catch him some Christmas Eve. Me, too! Here, Grandpa, put on your coat and hat, or we'll be late for the dinner. I'd rather stay here and talk to the children.

obfuscation: But Aunt Clara is expecting us; and also auto is at the door, and dimpling are you sure you got anything you wanted for Christmas; yet myself ca not believe in anything else.
original: But Aunt Clara is expecting us. And the auto is at the door. Dumpling, are you sure you got everything you wanted for Christmas? I can't think of anything else.

obfuscation: assuming that you did n't and if all three of you children can agree on anything else it shall be yours if money displace buy it, money displace buy everything ca n't it Grandpa, as no my dear not entirely all; and but guess our own serves wish for something that money ca not buy; and myself had try to have it all a few other way.
original: If you didn't, and if all three of you children can agree on anything else, it shall be yours if money can buy it. Money can buy everything, can't it, Grandpa? No, my dear, not quite everything. But suppose we wish for something that money can't buy? I'd try to get it for you some other way.
